title: 2 sans serifs
content:
I've been looking to identify those 2 for a while. The Repsol one could be a custom made for the brand.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317060633im_/http:/typophile.com/files/font_4697.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317060633im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Repsol_font_6685.jpg)

Font: 

 Amplitude Black 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317060633/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")
author: N1kkel

comments.content: First one could be [FB Amplitude](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317060633/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fontbureau/amplitude) Ultra and the second one as you said should be Repsol own corporate typeface simply called 'Repsol'.
Thanks again Ryuk, seems you're right on both.

Adding some details to the 'Repsol' case. This font has been designed by [Fontsmith](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317060633/http:/www.fontsmith.com/) and to me, looks like a customized (to what point?) version of their own [Sinclair](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317060633/http:/www.fontsmith.com/fonts/fs-sinclair.cfm).
